media:group.media:title: US Armenian groups hail Mehmet Oz‚Äôs Pennsylvania defeat
media:group.media:description:
üìçRepublican Senate candidate and former TV doctor Mehmet Oz is projected to lose a much-followed race in Pennsylvania. üìçAzerbaijani troops opened fire once again at Armenian positions last night, according to Armenia‚Äôs Defense Ministry. üìçThe United States is acting as a mediator between Armenia and Azerbaijan and not dictating the terms of a future peace deal, said State Department spokesperson Ned Price.

entry.title: Tourism boom sees 1.4 million visitors to Armenia so far this year

media:group.media:title: Tourism boom sees 1.4 million visitors to Armenia so far this year
media:group.media:description:
üìçArmenia has welcomed 1.4 million tourists so far this year in a post-pandemic, post-war boom, according to the country‚Äôs Tourism Committee. üìçThe Armenian government will form a special working group to study steps needed to establish an ‚Äúacademic city‚Äù outside of Yerevan. üìçStarting this month, people who have received Armenian citizenship and are applying for their first Armenian passport will have to do so online, the police said. üìçU.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken said he welcomes ‚Äúcourageous steps‚Äù by Armenia and Azerbaijan after meeting the two countries‚Äô foreign ministers in Washington.

entry.title: A fact-finding mission to Armenia‚Äôs southern border villages

media:group.media:title: A fact-finding mission to Armenia‚Äôs southern border villages
media:group.media:description:
Garo Ghazarian, an attorney, co-host of the Frontlines show, and advisor at the Tatoyan Foundation, spoke to CivilNet about his visit to Armenia‚Äôs southernmost Syunik region as part of a fact-finding mission. Ghazarian discussed the humanitarian situation in some Syunik villages, where Azerbaijani military posts are clearly visible, and how Azerbaijan can be held accountable for its actions in international courts.

entry.title: Azerbaijani soldiers open fire at Armenian tractor driver, Karabakh Interior Ministry says

media:group.media:title: Azerbaijani soldiers open fire at Armenian tractor driver, Karabakh Interior Ministry says
media:group.media:description:
üìçAzerbaijani soldiers shot at an Armenian tractor driver near the village of Khramort in eastern Karabakh, the region‚Äôs Interior Ministry said. The driver was not injured. üìçArmenia‚Äôs opposition staged a rally in central Yerevan in support of Karabakh, accusing Prime Minister Nikol Pashinyan of preparing to make concessions to Azerbaijan. üìçThe Prosecutor General‚Äôs office opened two cases seeking to seize a building in central Yerevan owned by businessman and politician Khachatur Sukiasyan and his family. üìçArmenia‚Äôs Administrative Court ruled in CivilNet‚Äôs favor in a major freedom of information case regarding the controversial sale of the Zangezur Copper-Molybdenum Combine, the country‚Äôs largest mine.

entry.title: Success and challenges in founding a tech startup in Armenia

media:group.media:title: Success and challenges in founding a tech startup in Armenia
media:group.media:description:
Yeva Hyusyan is the co-founder and CEO of Sololearn, a free-to-use digital platform that teaches coding to millions of people worldwide. Yeva sat down with CivilNet‚Äôs Mark Dovich to talk about her professional journey, the challenges of founding a startup in Armenia, and how the tech industry has changed the country. She also shared her thoughts on Armenia‚Äôs competitive edge in IT and how to take advantage of it.
